section.title: Problem
section.para: You want create topics of your DocBook document to use it with the new assembly element in DocBook 5.1.

section.title: Solution
section.para: Use the assembly/topic-maker-chunk.xsl stylesheet to create topics from your DocBook document. This breaks apart your existing document into modular files and creates an assembly file.
To disassemble an existing book.xml document, use the xsltproc like this:
section.screen: xsltproc --xinclude \ --stringparam assembly.filename assembly.xml \ --stringparam base.dir topics/ \ assembly/topic-maker-chunk.xsl \ book.xml
section.para: The xsltproc command outputs the master assembly file assembly.xml. The content is break up into modular chunks, saved in the topics/ directory.
